chargeHist.descr: Battery to Law Enforcement Officers, Fire Fighters or Commission Wardens
Battery to Law Enforcement Officers, Fire Fighters or Commission Wardens
Resist Officer - Substantial Bodily Harm/Soft Tissue Injury

result.execSummary:
The defendant Bradley T Sleeter Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery to Law Enforcement Officers, Fire Fighters or Commission Wardens, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.20(2).
  • Disarming a Peace Officer, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.21.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: DE will maintain absolute sobriety.   Defendant is not to consume or possess alcohol.  Do not enter premises where alcohol is primary business, any bars taverns or liquor stores.

superMiscConds.notes:
DE will remain absolutely sober.

DE will comply with all recommendations from DOC Agent.

Restitution owed will be a condition of probation.

Plus Supervision Fees.  If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due and all available enforcement actions may be used to collect the debt.  You must  keep the Clerk of Circuit Court informed of your current address until the debt is paid in full.

10:56 AM Defendant Bradley T Sleeter in court with attorney Stephanie E Thomas.  Defendant Bradley T Sleeter in custody.  Lester H Liptak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  No corrections to Revocation packet by the State.  Atty Thomas makes reference to restitution payment that's been paid.  Argument by the State, State requesting on Ct 2 6 in/6 out and Ct 3- 3 in/3 out consecutive, CV Judgment for unpaid restitution, court costs.  Sentencing argument entered by Atty Thomas.  Atty Thomas asking for 2 in/2 out on Ct 2 and 18 month in/2 yrs out on Ct 3.  Statement made to the court by DE.  Court gives sentence to DE.  

CT 2- DE WILL SERVE 3 IN/3 OUT


CT 3- DE WILL SERVE 3 IN/3 OUT, CT'S WILL RUN CONCURRENT.

DE will remain absolute sober, DE will comply with all recommendations of DOC agent, Rest will be a condition of probation.  Credit for 462 days on Ct 2.  95 days on Ct 3.  DE will not be eligible for SAP or CIB programming.
Sentencing hearing on revocation on August 20, 2019 at 11:00 am.  Notice for DE was given to him in the Rusk Co. Jail.
Discharge rescinded
Discharge rescinded

10:01 AM Attorney Stephanie E Thomas in court.  Annette M Barna appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  DAR used.  DE appears at 10:03AM.  Atty Thomas addresses the court as to the discharge of DE from probation.  DOC agent addresses the court as to the discharge date, believes that DOC had not possibly received the amended JOC extending probation.  Court will proceed with hearing extending probation.  DA Barna addresses the money remaining due on DE's case and payments that have been made by DE.  Atty Thomas wishes to clarify statements on finances.  Per the State DE has not made payments since 12/18.  Atty Thomas states DE informed her that DE is currently unemployed and incarcerated for one year on his charges.  DE states he was employed the last three months of his incarceration with huber but that job ended.  Mr Sleeter states he was employed at Jeld Wen but was terminated due to taking a one month family leave.  Ms Thomas states DE does have the letter of apology that was required.  The court will extend supervision for one year from the original discharge date of 4-19-19, not the date that supervision was extended.  DE to submit apology letter to DOC agent.  Court will disregard DOC's discharge notice of DE's probation.
Discharge-Regular

DOC has asked for a probation review due to non payment of financial obligations, and no letter of apology written to the victim.  3:01PM back on the record.  Atty Thomas requesting a RH be set, atty needs additional time to review matters in this case. Atty Thomas believes they can stipulate to extending probation for 30 days. The court will extend supervison to 5-03-19 @ 4:30PM.  Probation review hearing scheduled for May 3, 2019 at 10:00 am.

Sentencing hearing at 04-19-2016 02:00 pm

Defendant Bradley T Sleeter in court.  James Rennicke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  DE appears without counsel.  DE states to the court that he choose to not have counsel here today.  Court instructs on DE without counsel.  DE states reasons for releasing prior counsel.  DE has spoken to Atty Michael Rajek for counsel, but told him not to come today.  State is willing to allow DE time to contact PD office, but wishes the DE to be taken into custody today.  The court will appoint Atty Stephen Willett.  DE will repay the county for court appointed counsel.  Court will take this delay into account for sentencing purposes.  Court admonishes DE on delaying sentencing several times.   Court will revoke bond, DE will be taken into custody.  Set for sentencing April 19, 2:00PM. Atty will be furnished the PSI.
